description: The Prerana (Micro Credit Finance) Scheme in Karnataka encourages women from the Scheduled Caste (SC) community to form self-help groups (SHGs) and provides financial assistance for income-generating activities, promoting economic empowerment.
key_features: Financial support for SC womenâ€™s SHGs

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to Rs. 5 Lakhs per SHG for micro-enterprises
benefits.subsidy: Up to 50% subsidy on loan amount

residency_criteria: Must be a resident of Karnataka

eligible_activities: Training in SHG management and entrepreneurship

steps: Form or join an SC womenâ€™s SHG through the District Social Welfare Department
Submit an application through the SHG with a business plan
Attach required documents, including SHG registration and caste certificate
Applications are reviewed by the department
Approved SHGs receive funding and training

special_notes: Funding is provided to SHGs, not individuals
Priority is given to SHGs with viable business plans
